intro: Cerastium balcanicum var. anisophyllum, commonly known as the Balkan mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its prostrate or ascending stems covered with fine, silky hairs. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming in spring. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic, and often have a distinctive lobed base. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
